title: Drawing, "Drawing.  Botanical sketches from Colombia or Ecuador.", 1853
markings:
Recto:  Stamped in ink, twice at lower left: Lugt 457c
Verso:  Stamped in ink, at center: Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at top right:  strong marks red flowers / High bush with branches / of yellow flowers; again, at center right:  Green airplants / grey / dead leaves / red / rose col [or] flowers; again, at lower far left:  brown seeds / Bocconia; again, at left: csir plant red flower; and again at lower right:  large bush / seed caps.
description: Horizontal sheet containing  a group of botanical sketches: at top left is a tree; a top center is a group of plants on a hillside; at top right is a bough; at center right are four designs of a parasitic plant growing on a branch, three straight stems of plants, a top of a bush, and the top of a plant; across bottom row from are five plants, with a large margin at left side of the sheet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Drawing.  Botanical sketches from Colombia or Ecuador.", 1853.
1853. Graphite on cream-colored paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-879.
